data.name: HandleOriginalSavedDirectoryText
data.value: Your game directory contain saved data from your previous use of the game. In order to use the features of the launcher, the folder will be renamed and its content copied into a new profile to use with the launcher. All your data will still be under the folder Saved_Original.\nDo you wish to continue ?

data.name: InstallPathInGameError
data.value: Install path cannot be in the game Saved folder

data.name: GameDirectoryInvalidError
data.value: Game could not be found in this Directory

data.name: UACDialogText
data.value: Trebuchet require administrative rights in order to handle protected files for the following reason(s):

data.name: KillText
data.value: Killing a process will trigger an abrupt ending of the program and can lead to Data loss and/or data corruption. Do you wish to continue ?

data.name: GameFolderResetText
data.value: Your game directory contain saved data from your previous use of the game. Game Directory has been reset, please set it up again.

data.name: DeletionText
data.value: Do you wish to delete the selected profile {0} ?

data.name: InvalidURLText
data.value: The steam URL seems to be missing its ID to be valid.

data.name: InvalidJsonText
data.value: Loaded json could not be parsed.

data.name: ServerFailedStartText
data.value: Server failed to start properly. See the logs for more information.

data.name: ServerNotInstalled
data.value: Some server instances are not yet installed.

data.name: OnBoardingUpgradeUac
data.value: In order to upgrade your installation of Trebuchet, Write permission are needed. With your permission, Trebuchet will restart and request administrative privileges.

data.name: OnBoardingUpgrade
data.value: A previous installation of Trebuchet has been detected and must be upgraded to function with this version. Once this task is over, previous version of Trebuchet will not work anymore. Do you wish to proceed ?

data.name: OnBoardingUpgradeSub
data.value: If you do not wish to upgrade now, please close Trebuchet.

data.name: OnBoardingUpgradeCopy
data.value: Please wait while your files are being copied

data.name: SettingManageClientText
data.value: Allow Trebuchet to manage the game files. Files are moved out of the game folder and into you documents. This will protected them when reinstalling the game and allow you to have multiple save folder that can swap, useful if multiple persons play on the same computer.

data.name: OnBoardingUsageChoiceText
data.value: Please select what usage to intend to make of Trebuchet. This will preconfigure the app with base settings that you can change later if you change your mind.

data.name: OnBoardingUsageChoicePlayerSub
data.value: This will disable Trebuchet's server features

data.name: OnBoardingUsageChoiceServerSub
data.value: This will disable Trebuchet's game features

data.name: OnBoardingUsageChoiceModderSub
data.value: This will enable both server and game features for mod testing

data.name: OnBoardingLocateConanText
data.value: Indicate to Trebuchet where to find your Conan Exile game

data.name: OnBoardingLocateConanError
data.value: The folder selected does not contain Conan Exiles

data.name: OnBoardingManageConanText
data.value: Allow Trebuchet to handle your game files? If so, Trebuchet will move your game files located in the Saved folder, into your MyDocuments directory. This will allow two things: (a) To be able to create as many saves as you wish, and start the game using any of them (b) To offer extra settings for the game through Trebuchet

data.name: OnBoardingManageConanYesSub
data.value: Files will be moved to MyDocuments

data.name: OnBoardingManageConanNoSub
data.value: Your files will remain in the Saved directory

data.name: OnBoardingManageConanUac
data.value: To apply your choice, Trebuchet need permission to write into your game directory

data.name: OnBoardingChooseGameSaveText
data.value: Choose which game save need to be copied back into the game files

data.name: OnBoardingNewGameSave
data.value: Choose a name for the new trebuchet save that will contain your files

data.name: SettingBackgroundSoundText
data.value: Keep the sound of the game up when tabbing out to another window

data.name: SettingIntroVidText
data.value: Instead of displaying the intro video, you will have black screen that will swap to the main menu once the game is loaded

data.name: SettingUseAllCoreText
data.value: Supposed to improve performance on machines with lots of cores, unverified. Probably black magic

data.name: SettingProcessPrioText
data.value: Process priority of your server instance. Higher might make your server more responsive but at the cost of other OS processes responsiveness

data.name: SettingCpuAffinityText
data.value: CPU Thread Affinity help to assign specific cores to the server process

data.name: SettingUltraAnisoText
data.value: Increase the sharpness of angled textures on Ultra settings. This can have a performance hit depending on your hardware

data.name: SettingTexPool
data.value: Extra Texture Streaming Pool on Ultra (MB)

data.name: SettingTexPoolText
data.value: In order to not saturate your GPU memory with textures, the game constantly swap textures it does not need for the ones it needs. For that it reserve a portion of your memory to swap things out. By default on Ultra, that pool is 1500 MB in size. It's fine for the vanilla game, but with modded games it can be short when you are in an intensive area with lots of decorations, showing blurry textures more often. You can increase the base 1500 with this slider. Keep in mind that adding too much could have performance impact on your game

data.name: SettingAsyncSceneText
data.value: Can improve performance, specially around heavy building areas

data.name: SettingLogText
data.value: Display live game logs as the game is running

data.name: SettingAdminServerList
data.value: [Tot ! Admin] Do not load server list

data.name: SettingAdminServerListText
data.value: Prevent the sever list from auto refreshing from the main menu

data.name: SettingLogFilterText
data.value: Filter the log console to only display specific types of logs (One per line). This can greatly help to reduce your log size. Log levels are NoLogging, Fatal, Error, Warning, Display, Log, Verbose, VeryVerbose, All (=VeryVerbose)

data.name: SettingServerNameText
data.value: Name of your server instance in the game server list

data.name: SettingServerAdminPassText
data.value: Admin password of your server instance

data.name: SettingServerMaxPlayerText
data.value: Maximum authorized amount of playes on your server instance

data.name: SettingServerRegionText
data.value: Server region to be displayed in the server browser

data.name: SettingServerMapText
data.value: Starting path of the map you want to load on your server intance. The button contain a few known map path for easier setup

data.name: SettingSudoAdminListText
data.value: List of steam ID to be Sudo super admins on your servers, one per line. Leave it empty if you do not use Sudo.

data.name: SettingTotAdminPrecision
data.value: Disable Tot!Admin High Precision Move Tool

data.name: SettingTotAdminPrecisionText
data.value: For better compatibility with other move tools, disable two decimal scaling of Tot!Admin Move Tool

data.name: SettingServerKillZombiesText
data.value: Kill server instances that have stopped responding (frozen) for a period of time

data.name: SettingServerZombieDurationText
data.value: Amount of time given to a server instance to respond before getting killed by trebuchet

data.name: SettingServerCrashRestartText
data.value: Automatically restart a server instance that have stopped unexpectedly

data.name: SettingServerMaximumTickRateText
data.value: Maximum tick rate of your server instance

data.name: SettingServerUseAllCoresText
data.value: Supposed to improve performance on machines with lots of cores, unverified. Probably black magic

data.name: SettingServerProcessPriorityText
data.value: Process priority of your server instance. Higher might make your server more responsive but at the cost of other OS processes responsiveness

data.name: SettingServerCPUThreadAffinityText
data.value: CPU Thread Affinity help to assign specific cores to the server process

data.name: SettingServerGameClientPortText
data.value: Port used by the game client to connect to your server instance

data.name: SettingServerSourceQueryPortText
data.value: Port used by the server browser to query your server instance

data.name: SettingServerEnableMultiHomeText
data.value: Enable Multi Home to allow multiple IP to connect to your server instance

data.name: SettingServerMultiHomeAddressText
data.value: IP address to be used by Multi Home. Usually your local IP

data.name: SettingServerEnableRConText
data.value: Enable RCON on your server instance

data.name: SettingServerEnableVACText
data.value: Enable Valve Anti Cheat on your server instance

data.name: SettingServerEnableBattleEyeText
data.value: Enable Battle Eye on your server instance

data.name: SettingServerLogText
data.value: Display server live logs instead of a blank window. WARNING: This might render the zombie process detection ineffective. I don't advise using this on a production server

data.name: SettingServerNoAISpawnText
data.value: Prevent the spawn of common map NPC. Some categories of NPC are not affected by this, like the Siptha vaults

data.name: SettingServerLogFiltersText
data.value: Filter the log console to only display specific types of logs (One per line). This can greatly help to reduce your log size. Log levels are NoLogging, Fatal, Error, Warning, Display, Log, Verbose, VeryVerbose, All (=VeryVerbose)

data.name: SettingClientInstallationText
data.value: Indicate to Trebuchet where to find your Conan Exile game installation folder. You'll also be choosing if Trebuchet should handle your game files or not.

data.name: SettingServerInstanceCountText
data.value: The amount of server instance to be handled by this trebuchet. Leave it at 0 if you do not wish trebuchet to handle server launch

data.name: SettingAutoUpdateStatusText
data.value: Choose when to update your servers. This does not apply to client game

data.name: SettingUpdateCheckIntervalText
data.value: "The interval in seconds between each update check

data.name: SettingVerifyAllText
data.value: When checking for updated files, the system will check its cached data to quickly check if they need to be redownloaded again. By checking this option, you force the system to inspect the files every time. This will make the process of checking for updates much more slow but is usefull to detect corruption. If you suspect corruption, I advise to use the button on the dashboard instead of turning on this setting

data.name: SettingMaxDownloadsText
data.value: Max amount of files downloaded at the same time on the steam network. This can increase the load on your CPU/Drive/Network but make the download potentially faster if your network allow it

data.name: SettingMaxServersText
data.value: Max amount of content server used at the same time on the steam network

data.name: SettingDisplayWarningOnKillText
data.value: Click on a Kill button will display first a warning about data loss and corruption

data.name: ModlistReplaceText
data.value: This action will replace your mod list, do you wish to continue ?

data.name: SaveSizeTip
data.value: Total size of your save on disk. Profiles not only store your settings, but also your server saves and logs

data.name: ExportErrorModNotFound
data.value: Some of the mods path cannot be resolved because the mod file was not found. In order to export your modlist, please unsure that all of the mods are not marked as missing.

data.name: WrongTypeText
data.value: The type of file provided is unsupported.

data.name: VerifyFilesText
data.value: This will verify all server and mod files. This may take a while. Do you want to continue?

data.name: ClientFailedToStartText
data.value: See the logs for more information

data.name: OnBoardingServerInstanceCountSub
data.value: Choose how many server instance Trebuchet should manage. Unless you want to handle a cluster, one should be enough.
